item.title: Dog poo bin full, 21st July
item.description:
The dog poo bin is full, as is the litter bin next to it. The bins around the rest of the woods are generally kept well but this one seems never to be emptied frequently enough despite its easy location near the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Waterdale Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeds by side of road out of control, 21st July
item.description:
Weeds by side of road are out of control and basically bushes now. Also covering drains. Outside the school is the worst bit but also all over roads. Summer holidays Would be a good time to clear as outside school and less cars will be parked

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Belmont Road, Beckenham, London

item.title: Kids play area and fountain are FULL OF LITTER, 21st July
item.description:
Thanks to our wonderful council, our kids are destined to literally play among litter – pics speak for themselves. No wonder we have families leaving and schools have to close, because SOUTHWARK IS ANTI-FAMILY

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Churchyard Row, Elephant and Castle, London

item.title: White powder thrown into garden, 21st July
item.description:
Hi, As you can see in the images, some sort of white powder has been thrown into our garden. It has no smell so we’re unsure of what it is.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glenarm Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fridge dumped outside on the path between 66 and 64 crockenhill road, 21st July
item.description:
Fridge was dumped some time between 8.30am and 3.30pm it was in the middle of the path, we moved over to one side for pedestrian safety. It does not belong to us or neighbours on either side

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66, Crockenhill Road, St Mary Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Porch light on continuously, 21st July
item.description:
There is a light to the entrance of the maisonettes at 26 to 32 Bostall road. St Paul's Cray. This light is so bright and is on continuously all day and all night. It shines through our bedroom window and it's like a spotlight. Would it be possible to get this light changed to a sensor light. It would save a lot of electricity for the housing association as well.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bostall Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegally parked ice cream van, 21st July
item.description:
Two ice cream vans fighting over pitch. Van registration AGZ 9428 then drove onto Belmont Lane entrance and traded on school keep clear markings. Causes congestion and does not allow buses and cars to pull in to let other cars through. Council has done nothing about illegal, persistent parking outside the school.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Belmont Lane, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obstruction of highway, illegal, unsafe parking, 21st July
item.description:
Ice cream van parked on school keep clear markings. Happens daily. This is a different van from the usual. Council has done nothing about this despite many reports over several years. Now two vans are fighting over this ‘ pitch’. Please, please can something be done before a child is injured or worse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Edgebury, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
